intro: Leiphaimos montana, commonly known as the mountain leiphaimos, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested mountain areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
